title: Gin revival falls flat after sales fell over summer
text:
Spirits maker Distil warned that sales of traditional gins fell over the summer

The 'ginaissance' is running out of steam as drinkers turn to spiced rum this Christmas.

Spirits maker Distil warned that sales of traditional gins fell in a 'disappointing' slump over the summer.

But Distil said its shop and pub customers reported a double-digit jump in demand for bottles of its Red Leg Spiced Rum and cans of pre-mixed spiced rum and cola.

Distil reported a 29 per cent drop in revenue for the six months to September 30 and a loss before tax of £1,000, compared with a profit of £101,000 in the same period of 2018.

The company has previously warned the gin market is getting overcrowded.

The drink has partly boomed because it is relatively easy to make, compared with other spirits such as whisky.

But in May analysts at investment bank Jefferies declared: 'We think the gin boom has peaked.'
